page.title: 12Fruit Packing, Paddock Wood
page.content: Cottage Farms Fruit Packing Company grow their own fruit and sometimes collect fruit from other farms.They grow apples and pears. There are four apple orchards and one pear orchard. The people employed pick the fruit, and also pack it. The farm has 300 acres of land.Once the fruit has been packed it is collected by lorry and distributed for sale in Tesco's and Sainsbury super markets.Cottage Farms employs about 19 people for one year's work. There are 720 pounds of apples in one bin. The apples are placed in a coldstore after they have been washed with a special liquid to prevent rotting.Apples are packed six to a bag. They make their own labels marked with the date,type of apple and the price. They are not allowed to keep any animals on the farm because of the health risk.
